text:
From bottle. Pours a hazy yellowish with a Big White head. Aroma has lots of Stone fruits, cheese, parmesan, light oak. Taste is sour, crisp, juicy, tart, light spicy, light cheesy. Light, sparkly body and a High carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of peach, big funk, cheese, citrus, floral. Taste is lactic, sweet peach, citrus, floral, oak, light esters.

Pours orange with a white head. Aroma of cheese, funk, slight cheese, peach, mellow apricot and slight floral notes. Taste of peach, apricot, tropical white wine, funk, slight cheese and yellow gummibears.
Peach aroma with a crisp tartness edging into sourness. Funk levels are medium. Drinkability is modest but flavors are very good.

750ml bottle @ Alexs. Pours a cloudy golden orange colour with a tiny white head. Nose is funky, peach pits, and a hint of a sour note. Flavour has lightly tangy character, mild peaches with a mild sweetness. This is very drinkable but I would like more peaches as it is light overall.

750ml bottle (thx, Brian!) at Alexs in honor of my birthday and CPA PREP finish. Vintage 2016. Pours a cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is fermented fruits and veggies. Same taste with peaches notws. Moderate to high sourness. Pleasant.
750 white wax bottle purchased at brewery. This is superb. Yeasty and slightly tart with a big peach presence. Lovely.
Bottle thanks to Jonathan. Pours cloudy light orange with no head. Mild sweetness and tart finish. Medium mouthfeel. Huge peach and bandaid flavor. Slightly metallic finish.
Someone pulled this one out after about a year and unfortunately the fruit is basically non-existent at this point. It comes with a lovely dry nose but there is an unfortunate cheesiness to it now.
750ml bottle pours a golden color without much head. Delicate peach flavor. Some Bret at the end.

Shared at an Ann Arbor get together at Jeffs on July 20. 750 mL bottle. The pour is a foggy golden yellow color with a thick cap of white head that slowly fades. The aroma is incredibly funky. There is a light acidity and a ton of fruit. There is a brighter berry and citrus to it, and then the funk rolls in a little heavier. Here is a ton of juice here. The flavor is a little better. The funk is toned down, letting the flesh and juiciness of the peaches really shine. There is a tart citrus and a lovely berry happening. The mouth feel is really good. Its light and crisp with a bright carbonation and a heavy juiciness at the same time. It finishes crisp and dry with a peachy flesh and dry funk on the back end. This is pretty good. Not quite what I was expecting, but incredibly balanced!

Bouteille de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Odeur de pêche avec une pointe de levure sauvage. Apparence: La couleur est orangée opaque. Saveur: Goût de pêches avec une pointe de citron et de levure sauvage. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement sûrette. (Rating #7033)

My Bottom Line:
Strawberry allusions blend in nicely with the lambic-like funk, playing harmoniously with lactic acidity.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam surrounds the misty golden honey.
-The soft effervescence, dryness and acidity make for high drinkability.
-The fruit character is warm and juicy (not necessarily full on peaches; I got more strawberry and kiwi than peaches actually).
-This is not just another funky beer. It actually has a unique profile that is showcased in a refined manner. Very, very good brew.

Bottle.

Bouteille 750ml au Québec Ratebeer Gathering. Couleur dorée pâle légèrement voilée, mousse blanche. Arôme de pêche, levures sauvages, foin. Goût de pêche, acidité moyenne, levures sauvages. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2017 2017-03-25, bottle, Sergeys birthday party, 6% ABV, 7-3-8-4-16=38Cloudy orange color with small to no head. Complex, fruity, peachy, and a bit lemony, with elegant acidity; much better than when I had it on tap. Excellent.2016-01-01, draught at Alibi Room, Vancouver, 10th Anniversary party, 7-3-7-3-14=34Cloudy, golden, and flat. Sour, definitively it has Lambic notes, more lemon, but also light cheese/yeast notes; some aroma of peach and yeast.Nice, but I expected more.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 Re-rate 1/29/17: Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Tart, funky, fruit. Really good. 8/3/8/3/16=3.8

[1/28/16] Draught at Almanac & Friends Sourfest at MaSo at Park Central Hotel in San Francisco. Hazy golden. Sour aroma, funky, oaky, with peaches. Tart flavor, oaky, with peach, citrus. Medium-bodied. Great and refreshing. 8/3/8/3/17=3.9

Mydude is not in my dining room, but he is truly killin it. 
Pours a hazy yellow with a small head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is reasonably earthy at the start but this gives way to bright fruit i.e. lemon and apricot especially. The funkiness is mild, a touch horse blanket like and a little leathery. 

The flavor is bright and fruity with lots of apricot. The beer is medium dry and has a very pleasant level of sourness. The beer has some faint herbal notes and a little bit of bitterness. The acidity is brilliant and the woodiness seems like white oak, although who knows. Just lots of tartness & apricot. 

 just fantastic
Bottle shared by Jeff at Darkness day. Pours cloudy golden. Nice funky peach aroma. Taste follows with nice tartness. Really good stuff.
750ml bottle pours out a cloudy apricot topped with a white head. Nose is peach apricot barrel nice tart funk. Taste is more of the peach apricot sour tartness some nice sweetness.
Bottle shared by Jeff - thanks! Hazy gold pour. Peachy sour, some funk. Bright palate. Awesome!

Golden colour, hazy white head. Aroma of cheese, wild yeast, hint peach and rotten yoghurt, somewhat reminding of a De Troch lambic. sour flavour, quite fruity, peach, lactic acid. finish peach and rotten yoghurt. Not bad, but not great. Expected more.
(from 75cL bottle shared @ Sunday Bottle Share, CBC Clerkenwell; RBESG 2014, London)

Waxed bottle, poured and split at a tasting. Huge thanks to Prufrockstar for sharing this and feeding my latest craze of peach sours. And for teaching me how to pronounce the name of this beer. Love the description on here by the way. It explains as much about this beer as I probably can. Pours a cloudy yellow, orange (peach) color with no head. Reading this bottle, Im truly confused, but I know the beer is good, so thats all that matters. Frsh peach aroma. Candy peach flavor with a belgian yeast hinted finish. SO damn good. FAHNTAHZEEA
Bottle...Pour is golden with whote head..Nose is smarties, spice, peach skin, funk..Taste is tart, funk, oak, dry, lemon, dusty..

750 mL, unsure of the date, shared by Scott on 7/25/15.White peach colored body is gently hazy and has a small, white head that recedes to cover.Near perfect mix of peach and lactic acid in the nose is gentle yet still contains some lightly bright elements of peach juice. Nicely attenuated malts add little to no sweetness and allow some grainy character to assert some beeriness here. Subtle funk, a bit of earthiness and just more lactic-peach goodness lingering.Flavor is impossibly mild, yet with soft sourness and good, earthy funk. Damp hay, sun-baked grains and moderately sweet peach-apricot flavors are all extremely enjoyable. Lighter carbonation, but whats there is tight, providing good crispness to the finish and accentuating the sour acidity and vibrant fruit character. Watery and just unbelievably drinkable. This one took me my surprise. Finished it so fast on account of how good it was and now I want more just thinking about it. No alcoho, no flaws.

750 ml bottle, thanks to Scott at Adams farmhouse Magnum tasting. Aroma is apricot, peaches, light funky yeast, mild bread.
The flavor is juicy! Damn juicy, good amount of yeast. Damn, better then Fou Foune?? Perhaps

Poured from bottle thanks Scott for the Ratebeer Farmhouse Magnum Tasting. Hazy golden pour with a thin white head. Aroma of sour stone fruit and yeast and funk. Taste is apricot and has a nice finish.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 750mL bottle shared by Scott opened at Ratebeer Farmhouse Magnum Tasting v1. Thanks! Pours slightly orange yell gold with an off white head. Aroma is citrus, funk, blue cheese. Flavor is wow! Apricot! Maybe a hint of tart cherry skin in the finish.
Wow from the first sniff. Smarties, acidic, peach skins, bits of sulfur, woody oaky, creamy, bretty funk in a very pretty wet leaves on a teail on a rainy day. So so pretty. Enormous.
Bottle. Hazy pale yellow beer with an offwhite head. Sourish peach grassy citrus floral aroma. Sourish peach grassy citrus floral flavour.

Bottle at home. Pours cloudy light golden orange, light fizzy white head. Stewed apricot in the nose, peach stone, wheat and whey, some sweet yoghurt. Light body, almost watery, nice light carbonation, slightly sour and quite a dry and citrussy finish. Tastes a bit bland but a great thirst quencher overall.
Hazy pale yellow pour with a tinge of peach. Slight white head. Sour peach nose. Soft fruit. Slightly sweet. Slightly funky finish. Slightly tart. Delicate and refreshing.

Batch 1 bottle thanks to Aaron. Pours a cloudy orange with small paperthin white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong peach, funk, and oak. Thin mouthfeel with strong peaches, brett, nice tartness, really enjoyed this.
Batch 2 bottle thanks to Aaron. Pours a cloudy orange with frothy medium white head that lasts. The aroma is strong peach and brett. Much more fruit forward, and nice tartness, really impressive.
Tap, brewery, gold pour, white head, nose is peaches, taste is peaches, tart, delicious

Poured from bottle to glass. Golden hue with fizzy white head that settled. Aroma is peach, apricot, lactic, straw. Mouthfeel is great with a light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry sweet with a tart following. Overall this brew is great.
UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 Smells and tastes like awesome peaches. This is an absolutely fantastic sour and one of the best I?ve had.  Medium body, medium to high sharp carbonation, and slight foam.

Huge thanks to Prufrockstar for sharing this bottle. Peaches and vanilla on the aroma, also quite funky. This transition to the medium, quite fruity body. We kind of settled on white chocolate as the synthesis of flavors we were trying to figure out. Some souring, plenty of peppery notes on backend. Tasty treat.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2015 Bottle split with friends. Appearance: Head lasts only for a second. Cloudy orange in the glass. Aroma is odd - peach-flavored laffy taffy and bubblegum. Some funk and oak for sure, but what comes through behind that is peach flavored laffy taffy bubblegum. Taste brings vanilla, more laffy taffy, and now that Matt mentions it, cookies and cream Hersheys white chocolate. Not at all what I expected. Sweeter than anticipated. Theres tartness for sure, and some funk to boot, but mostly what comes across behind that is a lot of vanilla and sweetness. Peaches and cream. Palate: light body, soft carbonation, slick texture. Overall: I may sit on a bottle. Or I may not. Ive been wanting this for a long time. Glad to have had it. Not something I expect Ill crave, but Ill repeat it down the road.
  Having repeated this now a few times, its worthy of a bump, from 8/3/8/4/15 to 8/4/8/4/16.

Prufrock brought this rare gem back from Portland -- thank you for giving me the chance to try it. Light orange pour, modest white head. At first the nose brings on a powerful funk, but that is quickly replaced by very sweet artificial candy flavors. We struggled for a bit to pick them out; candidates include laffy taffy, spree, Haribo gummy peaches for the fruit; fruity bubble gum; white chocolate or in particular cookies-and-cream bar. The flavor is sweet-tart, very accessible with ample peach sweetness rather than peach-skin tartness. Some interesting tannic elements and modest overall acidity. Its a good beer, and enjoyable to drink, but this batch is not a world-beater, and it leaves me wondering how this could be a 99th percentile sour.

ivorywhite head disappears fast. lemmonyellow colour, bit murky. aroma is funky, horse, citric acid and peach. taste like aroma, with lactic acid and some wood notes. medium body and carbonation. great balance and complexity, a great USA version of FouFoune imho!bottle 75cl

If you would like to smell & taste apricot, peaches, lactic sour, citric acid, oak notes, - go ahead this is your beer. Very balanced sour, good mouthfeel. Is at par with Foufoune imho. A nice American Sour! Keep up the good work Upright Brewing!

Bottle shared at the RBESG 2014, grand tasting 10/08/2014 Craft Beer Co Clerkenwell. Clouded yellow / straw coloured pour with a thin white head. Aroma is cheesey fruit, lacto sourness, tart acid and funk. Bit of sour milk in the nose as well. Flavour is peach melba, wheat, sour apricot fruit, lacto sour. Goood shit. Palate is semi-sharp, crisp and somewhat wheaty. Tasty.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow, orangish pour and a white head. Sweet juicy peaches, moderately tart sourness, bread, Brett funk, sweet stone fruit, notes of berry, and citrus. Very tasty, and overall fairly mild sour. Refreshing.

(bottle) murky pale golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of coconut and peaches, quite dusty, with a hint of yeast, some lemons, strawberries and honey. flavour is more coconut, some floral hops and mouldy peaches, slightly sweet and chalky, with a light lemon tartness. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

"Holy hell this is one good brew. Best peach beer ever. Easily. Great mix of ripe juicy peach and stinky cheese. If you told me Cantillon made this Id believe you. 2012 was a little funkier, 2013 a little fruitier, but with a more than adequate sour aspect. Love it!"

How: Bottle.
Where: RBESG 14 not so grand tasting.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit, floral, a bit sour.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Citrus, sour, tropical fruit, some floral.

Sour fruity aroma and taste, light funky and floral, with some orchard apple fruity notes on the palate. Very nice.

Bottle at DC Epic Sour Tasting 2014, courtesy of noodleuser, thank you sir! Ive been tantalizingly close to tasting this one several times before, thank, Joel, for finally making it happen. Hazy yellow color, fluffy of white head. Gorgeous aroma of perfume, fresh meadows, light funk, grapes that have been carried around in someones grandmothers skin folds (and I mean hat in a good way). Taste is softly sour mixed summer fruit, lavender, berries. Delicious.

Bottle drank during RBESG; hazy yellow pour with a frothy white head, lovely peach aroma, taste has an excellent level of acidity well balance with fruit, peach, apple, citrus, has that lip puckering sourness, excellent use of brett. Real stand out beer of the RBESG Sunday tasting at craft.
Sour, earthy, subtly fruity aroma. Tart, fruity (apple-ish?) flavor. Earthy flavor is subtle. Sweeter finish.
Bottle Craft Clerkenwell tasting RBESG14. Cloudy gold lasting white head. Sour aroma. Sour apple skins. Good.
Bottle - Sour grape and lemon and little funk. Cloudy orange with almost no head. Tart and acidic with some stone fruit in the finish. A little lacto in the finish and quite nice.
Light gold, hazy, thin off-white head. Aroma of grainy malt, peaches, light sourness. Flavor is similar, moderate sour funk, peaches, strawberries, french bread.

Bottle. Pours glowing apricot color with small head that dissipates. Aroma is amazing: softly acidic ripe peach, tropical fruit, saltwater, lemon. Taste is ripe and juicy piece, orange, lemon. Great balance, long finish. One of the best fruited sours, especially American, that Ive had.

Bottle 1 pt 9.4 fl oz at Fruits of the Foeder, 2014-05-17.Cloudy straw yellow color, white head. Sweet, floral, perfume, fruity scent. Floral, spicy, fruity taste. Floral aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness. Apricots.

750ml bottle pours a clear gold with some sudsy white head. Nose is nice, sweet, honey, loads of peach, apricot, nectarine, white grape, perfume, just loads of fruit. Flavor is beautiful, sweet, lightly tart, fruity, dripping ripe peach, ripe nectarines, a little pinot gris, white grapes, lavender, honeysuckle, a little zucchini blossom. Clean, fruity finish. Superb.

Small sample from bottle @ Zeebra II. Pous hazy dark yellow with a small white head. Aroma of peach, apricot, yellow fruits and some malts. Taste has yellow fruits, peach,a soft sourness, some yeast and a medium bitter, slightly dry, finish. Medium body and carbo. Nice and refreshing.

Bottle @ tasting, courtesy of kermis. Small gusher. Pours a hazy amber, headless beer with the aroma of butter, peaches, diacetyl and tropical fruit. Flavor is light sour, yeasty and a bit messy. Could be infected, could be the American take on a Belgian style. Way too yeasty and buttery for me, yet the fruity touches of this are pretty nice as well. Decent, but certainly not impressive.

Bottled @ Zeebra #2. Sampled 5cl. The aroma has mango, citrus, sweetness, hint of honey. Clear, yellow coloured beer with a thin, white head. The taste is citric, has citric sourness. Its wild, its refreshing. The aroma is fantasiatastic, taste is okay, but does not have the x-factor.

Bottle shared. Pours murky orange light brown with no head. Aroma of peach, apricot, light rubber, and a strange meatiness. Flavour is light sweet and moderate acidic. A little minty character coming out in the finish. Medium bodied with flat carbonation.

Sample courtesy of Kermis.
Very thin head. Cloudy orange pour. Sweet/sour taste. Not a bad sour.
Balance is awesome, with all the forces tended. Citrus, sour plum and some barrel. Finishes with light medium sourness. Cloudy orange with ok head and lacing. Bottle thanks to Noodleuser.

Bottle shared at DC Annual Epic Sour Tasting, thanks Noodleuser! Hazy apricot yellow with off-white head. Aromas of tart fruit, vinegar, lemon, light funk. Tastes of vinegar, stone fruit, tropical fruit, funk, floral and herbal notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Good.

From a bottle shared at the DC Epic Sour Beer Tasting. Thanks Noodleuser! Pours a murky gold with an off white head. Aroma of peach and grapes. Flavors of tart white grapes with some plastic notes. Soft mouth feel. Sour finish.
Bottle. Poured a cloudy yellow-orange color with a small wispy head. Aroma is notes of fruit, tropical, peach. Flavor was fruit, peach notes, light tart notes. Very tasty.

Big thanks to noodleuser for sharing! Mostly clear golden pour, fizzy rim of a head. Nose and flavor are lovely, with stinky cheesecloth, blue cheese, peach, bright tangerine. Smooth, tangy. Really damn good.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you bytemesis! Pours hazy pale brownish yellow with a rather small frothy white head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is tiny sour and fruity with crackers, peaches, lemon juice, peach skins, hay, dry soil, white pepper corns, apricots and lemon zest. Taste is slightly sour and fruity with crackers, heavy peaches, lemon juice, hay, dry soil, barnyard, lemon zest and hints of horse blanket. Mouthfeel is soft, dry, slightly tart and light to medium bodied. Finish is slightly sour and fruity with crackers, peaches, hay, dry soil, lemon zest and barnyard.balanced and very tasty.

Fruits of the foeder @ Alex
Hazy yellow with a white head. 
Sourish aroma with peaches. 
Light body, fresh palate. 
Sour flavour with peaches.
Gyllengul oklar dryck med arom av söta persikor. Smak av citrus, aprikoser och grapefrukt.

Bottle at Fruit of the Foeder, 2014-05-17. Hazy pale yellow beer with a small white head. Sourish peach aroma, grassy, citrus, grapefruit, floral, some apricot. Sourish peach flavor, apricot, lemongrass, floral, citrus, hay notes. Sourish peach flavor. Very nice.

This was sampled at Dark Lord Day 2014. Pours a  hazy orange color with al white head.  Nose is sour fruit.  Medium to full body. Smooth in the moutht. Flavor is fruit, and pepper, and the finish is tart. . Really tasty and enjoyable. Amazing the great beers you find at DLD
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. brett funk
Deliciously smooth and balanced wild beer. Has a bretty sourness and a funky mouthfeel. Grassy taste of oak and fruits. Very nice.
Bottled @ Zeebra #2, small sample. Slight hazy golden color, short frothy head. Fruity, lemon, strawberry, flowery. Bit sweet, slight tart. Funky, saisonesque, brett. Nice beer.

At Zeebra Beer Festival, THX to everybody sharing todays beers.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: sour, sweet, nice and fruity.
TASTE: sour, peach, fruity, very nice.
Sampled @ Zeebra 2014. Not so complex. A bit watery, sour, not that much to it. Still hood drinkable, but just not that special. Disappointing beer given the high ratebeer score..
Pours a golden yellow unclear beer with a good white head. Smells mango, peach or lychee. Nice. Tastes medium sour, fruity, peach. Average carbo, thin body and a watery texture.

Batch 1 bottle. 
Aroma is super fruity with tons of peach and dried apricots. Light acidity and funkiness with faint oak character. 
Pours a cloudy orange with a small, thin, white head that recedes quickly to the edges. Light lacing and small legs.
Flavor is also very fruity with a lot of preach and dried apricots. Light oak notes with medium light acidity and some citrus funkiness. Light bitterness. Light pale malt notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium low carbonation. Low astringency with low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a really nice beer that had held up well. Lots of fruit notes that dominate the flavor and aroma. This beer aged really well.
Bottle. Golden hazy pour with white head. Citrus and funky aromas. Flavor is nice and funky, fruit, tart and finishes sweet.

Bottle at 7 Eclipse Tasting. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a small white head. Pretty tart with some sweetness. Aromas of sour peaches and hints of sour milk. Medium to full bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Dry and taet finish with hints of black pepper.

Bottle. Light hazy yellow with a small white head. Crisp apples, sweet peaches, light wood, hay, light barnyard, light lactic. Medium body, medium sweet and sour, soft carbonation, oily texture. Very tasty and drinkable.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 9.4 ounces, from and with Stephen Morris (merci!), savoured on December 13 2013; eye: golden with a whitish hue, hazy, no effervescence, no head no lacing; nose: Brettanomyces yeast, musk, light barn, green apple, fruity; mouth: Brettanomyces yeast, musk, light barn, green apple, fruity, dry finale in peach with presence of musk, medium body, below-average carbonation, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, de et avec Stephen Morris (merci!), savourée le 13 décembre 2013; il : dorée avec une teinte blanchâtre, voilée, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : levure Brettanomyces, musc, léger étable, pomme verte, fruitée; bouche : levure Brettanomyces, musc, léger étable, pomme verte, fruitée, finale sèche en pêche avec présence de musc, corps moyen, carbonatation sous la moyenne, texture légèrement rugueuse; en résumé : bien

Thanks to Andy! Smell is mild sour fruit, peach, mild coconut, mango, yeast. The taste is peach, coconut, vanilla, mango. It is dry and crisp. The body is light with active, fine carbonation. Very tasty stuff.
Mild säuerlicher Pfirsichantrunk. Im Mittelteil gleichen sich Säuerlichkeit und Süße aus, runde natürliche Fruchtnoten. Zum Ende eher bitter als sauer, kurzer Abgang. 11/9/9/7/9/8

Bottle shared at the January 2014 tasting in Santa Cruz. Vinous and peachy aroma, big lemony citric acid notes. Flavor is sour and citric up front before melting into a delicious sweet peach syrup/candy finish. Awesome.
Pours cloudy pale amber small white head. Aroma is sour fruity acidy as is Flavor, tart clean finish

750 ml bottle from a trade.Batch 2 I think. Shared with the missus. Bottle had some small seapage from the cap even though it was waxed. Pours a golden quite clear fluid with a small head that settles fast. Aroma is slight vinegar, lemon and unripe peaches. Aroma is not as tart as expected, nicely balanced with loads of peaches and barnyard funk. Very similar to Fou Foune which I had recently, this might have been a tad better though.

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with with bubbly white head. Smell is peaches, apricots, barnyard funk, and slight vinegar. Taste follows, sweet peaches, floral, barnyard funk. Solid dry finish. Such amaze.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy orangey color ale with a medium size white head with ok retention and some light lacing. Aroma of light fruit notes with some tart notes that are easily discernible. Taste is a mix between some light apricot notes with some tart notes with a light funky finish. Body is somewhat full with good carbonation. I must admit that my expectation were quite high but this seems to lack the complexity I was anticipating.

Bottle @ The HUGE Tasting. Cheers, Bruce! Slightly hazy gold with a small head. Loads of peach and apricot. Orchard fruits. Dirty countryside funk. Mild accents of mandarin. More fruit leather flavors. Perfumed grass. Hints of jasmine. Light body, effervescent. Deft and very tasty. Great.

Bottle shared last night by Mike, thanks for the opportunity!
Cloudy golden color with a minimal head. Huge cheesy funky brett aroma with hints of lemon and tart cherries. Huge peach flavor atop a funky earthy tart background. Very nice beer!

Bottle. Pours lightly hazy yellow with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with spare lacing. Aroma is peach, orange, and pears, all sour/lactic, wheat malt and stale hops, light Chardonnay notes. Flavor is lactic fruits, light malt, hops and bitterness with vinous notes and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
2014 Vintage 750ml Bottle - Juicy peaches and apricots upfront, nice mildly sour acidity and a crisp dry finish. Sunshine in the bottle, one of my favorite sours!

Batch #1
Tasted in summer 2012 with Curtis and the Nashville crew. Pours hazy yellow/orange with an average white head that leaves a nice collar of lace. The nose is nicely sour with tons of lemon acidity, a hint of white wine vinegar, and tons of peach, trending to the under-ripe. The flavor is a bit more ripe with peach, quite sour but not abrasive, white wine vinegar, and a touch of vanilla barrel treatment. The body is light and tannic with average carbonation and a long sour peach finish. Big thanks to Sean von Tagen for sharing this one with me so many different times.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2014 At c&g tasting. Aroma is soft sour peaches, apricot, awesome. Taste is awesome, soft peach fruits beautiful sour notes. 4.1

At Seths with Seth Taylor, Stephen, and Dina. Pours neon orange, with some lacing, aroma is fresh sour, apricot, smooth
Blood orange, fresh and delicious authentic light fruits. Taste is fresh apricot tart, dry. Love this. Its a tart delicious saison that is light and fresh. 4.1

Batch 3

Pours a peach meat color with a fine white sheet. Smells sour, lactic bite is there before I even get into it. Then there is some sweet peach, some grain, some funk. Nice nose, Im anticipating some really sour beer here.....Its sour, then, some bicarb, some funky brett notes. Clean finish. the peaches arent there for me. Medium on light bodied with medium on high carb and a semi dry finish. Nice beer, not a beer youd nut off to get to...Honestly.

Thanks to tom10101 for arranging the trade, thanks to (sorry. I forgot your handle) for the actual beer. Pours a pale golden and is topped by a small head that transform into a thin veil but you can easily revive it. Low lacing power, though. Aroma is of peaches, sour wheat and grass. Taste is tart, fruity (bursting with peaches and apricots). It also contains some light wheat notes and yeast. Mouthfeel is really light, almost watery. This isnt a bad thing necessarily, it is really drinkable. Really nice and never too much.

pours unclear pale golden-orange with a small white cap, soem retention and lacing. dusty, minty, citrus, few tropical notes, soft brettiness, also cheesy, nicely fruity and almost juicy - peaches and other small yellow fruits, woodsiness - hint of vanilla and soft white wine. moderate carbonation, light body, light acidity - never pungent, drying citrusy finish. very good!

On tap at Upright 
Cloudy yellow with a small white head and some light lacing. Aroma is cheese, hay, barnyard and citrus. Flavors are vinegar, straw and fruity 
Nice, easy drinking.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 Glass at the brewery. Pours a somewhat cloudy orange color with a large white head. A huge nose of peaches, massive dusty cheese. The flavor is more massive Brett/cheese, sweet peaches, tart at times, vinous, oak, the base of tart peaches comes in big at times like a sparkling wine. Huge dusty cheese.

3rd January 2014Mega Tasting at Bruces pad. Cheers to Bruce. Very hazy gold beer, small white head. Palate is crisp and dry. Light tantalising acidity. Mild floralness and a touch of worcester sauce. Crisp dry finish.

Bottle. Off the menu offering from Bruce at that crazy mega tasting. Been looking forward to this one for a while - cheers! It pours hazy golden-orange with a small white head. The nose is soft peach, juicy fruits, sherbet, apricot yogurt, funk and wood. The taste is crisp, tart, plenty of peach and apricot, earth, straw, funk, sherbet and hay with a dryish finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Has a nice amount of sweetness behind it to balance out the tartness. Crisp, tart and fruity. Very quaffable stuff.

Bottle split at the Broken Flatmate tasting, big thanks to Bruce for whipping this one out, 03/01/14.
Murky orange amber with little in the way of a head or covering.
Nose is tarte fruit, orange sherbet, straw, fleshy peach, tarte apricot, light damp wood shavings.
Taste comprises lemon rind, hay, tangy citric fruit, bitter apricot, orange sherbet, grassy.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet tingle in a drying closure.
Nice work!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 Bottle at the big tasting. A nice surprise to see this thanks to Bruce. Pours hazy golden with a dense white head leaving sticky lacing. Nose is very tangy stuff - passionfruit forward with bright tropical fruits in front of the funk. Taste is funky lemon biscuit, more tangerine and mandarin. Tropical focus is pleasing. Loads of passionfruit giving to great sweetness and adding to the drinkability. Clean as they come. Great stuff

Bottle shared for Jacks presence in London. The cartoon label seems off. But still, thanks to Bruce for sharing. Pours hazy yellow-gold with a creamy white head. Some tangy citrus in the nose, touches of apple, hay. Light sweet flavor with more hay, tangy lemon, pale malts. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Pretty clean finish, tangy citrus, soured Wheaton lots of lemon, so,e tangerine. Lovey beer.

In short: A wild, fruity and dry orange ale with a weak mouthfeel.
How: Bottle 750ml, white waxed top, consumed when some months of age, bottle sent to me by julian, thanks a lot Julian (how long did it take you to come up with your ratebeer nickname?).
The look: Cloudy orange body topped by an off-white ring of foam.
In long: Nose is somewhat fruity and with a nice rustic & wild character, bretty, lactic, cobweb, a piece of fruits I found in my armpit, peaches, candied oranges. The mouthfeel unfortunately lacks vigour, plenty of body for its size but the sparse carbonation (to put it mildy) is the beer weak point. Taste is fruity (peaches and various dried fruits) supported by a dry grainy malt backbone that feels like yellowed sundried straws. Moderately funky and moderately sour and fortunately almost no vinegary flavor. Tart fruits along with a sour yogurt sensation. Wild yeast and oak tannins take over at the end for a very dry finish. Overall pretty good, Im certain a more lively body would have increased my enjoyment of the flavors, not just the mouthfeel. Everytime I receive a box of beers I ask the UPS guy if he would like to watch me open the package, making friends is hard.

Bottle pours with a slightly hazy gold body that supports a near white head. The aroma offers up tartness, lemon, lime, soft vinegar notes and then a modest degree of sweet fruitiness. The taste has a mix of lime peel and lemon rolling into spicy funky yeastiness that has a mild soft vinegar edge to it. I like the balance where it isnt straight up tart and acidic.
750ml bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with an averaged sized head. Floral, some funkiness, fruity, citrus, and some wood.

Bottle from batch #2 opened up at the 2013 year end Ottawa tasting, cant remember who I traded with for this one but thanks as the crew was happy to be able to try it! Hazy pale yellow with lots of sediment and a light head. Smooth, peachy, some barnyard, brett, agree with Luc on the epson salts and some buckwheat honey. Moderate carbonation and pleasant body, easy to drink although a little sweet, dry on the finish with a bit of chardonnay.
Pours cloudy straw. Nose is peach with light sour and some barnyard, some lemon. Light body with some acidic bite.

A hazed golden sour ale with a thin white head. In aroma, smooth fruity Brett laden ale with peaches, Epsom salts, very nice. In mouth, a nice peachy pulp, very smooth Epsom and lactic notes, very nice. Xmas Ottawa gathering Dec 13 2013.

White wine funky notes here and there fresh peach creamy notes. Nice and peachy. Golden orange pour no head. Some what still looking. Fuzzy fresh peach light creamy sweetness white wine barrel notes. Lightly tart nice and fruity.

Golden colour with a small pale head. Aroma is peach, citrus peel, candy sugar, honey, hint of brett. Medium-light body, tart in the palate with a fruity background and a slightly dry finish. Taste is peach, honey, brett, citrus peel.
Tap sample at seraveza. Pleasant beer. Nice and dry. Good balance of peach and funk.
Bottle from me! Fucking peach love nugga. Absolutely amazing beer from Upright. I really am impressed. Who knew?

Bottle. Slightly hazy light golden pour. Smells amazingly good, fruity, citrusy, nice acidity. 
Not as sour taste as the aroma implies. Balanced, very fruity, light sour. When taking a sip I want another right away. Really good sour beer.

Pours a peachy hazy yellow color with a finger of white fizzy foam. The nose is fieldgrass, light peach fuzz, wet funky oak and a bit of light honeyed malt. The palate is very pleasing with a great balance between funky tart peach and round musty barrel notes. Vanilla, peach, lactic and a trace of rustic graininess to tie it all together ! Yum
750ml bottle batch 1 pours a off copper orange with light peach aroma. Sour peach taste

Pours murky grapefruit color with no head. 

Smell is tart and funky.

Taste is peaches, bit of a tart earthiness, juicy.

Not mouth puckeringly sour, light bodied.

Good

750 ml bottle shared by b3shine. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have a great peachy fruitiness, tart, lightly acidic, some floral notes, a touch of wood some sweetness as well. This is very drinkable.

Bottle - pours amber with nice carbonation. Lots of peaches in the nose. Tart and acidic taste with peaches. Solid. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by b3shine. Poured a clear amber color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a sticky tingly texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour & sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet & sour finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer for style.
Bottle, peach tasting. Pours cloudy peach, small white head, some lacing. Aroma is funk, lemon, peach, fruity, Brett. Flavor is light sweet, light tart, very fruity. Medium body, nice!

750ml, shared by b3shine. Clear golden orange color. Little white head, couple loose dots of lace. Medium body. Smooth, crisp lighter carbonation. Lightly dry in the finish. Nice oaky flavor. Some peach, apricot. Moderate tart taste. Light sweet. Very tasty, moderately sour fruit beer.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared by me with the group). Looks good; a transparent gold with white lacing. Smells good; wild with a nice peach presence. Tastes like it smells with a nice mouthfeel and fairly dry finish. Good stuff!

Shared by b3shine. Pours a light golden With a minimal head. Tastes great with a medium sour flavor and citrus note. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Belmont station. Colour...hazy cidre gold with no head. Nose...funky, spicy and barnyard-like with lemon and peach notes. Palate...supple, lively and filled with tart funkiness and sour power. Not quite a pucker fest in a glass but quite nice nonetheless. Underripe peach and peach skin cones across the mid palate as does quince and kumquat. The finish is fabulously long and tart.
Bottle at the Mikkeller&Friends Appartment - Thanks. Abricot. Some light sourish.  Earthy. Bitter. High dryness. Citric. Light barnyard. Tart. Ok wooden notes. Very pleasant.
Bottle pour. Pours a hazy copper with a thin white head. Musty peach sweetness. Juicy sourness n the taste. Dy tart finish.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2013 Bottle through trade poured a golden in color with a fizzy white head that fell right off. Aroma has peach, brett, light acidity, some funk, and fruit skins. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation on the lower side. Flavor again has fresh peach, dry brett, and light acidity leaning into tartness. Very nice with gentle fruit. As the bottle moved on and it had a chance to really open up the flavors were much more pronounced and juicy.

Bottle. The pour is a light yellow. Th e aroma is huge sour. The taste is very pale. Not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottles thanks to Aaron. 2012 & 2011. Both were similar with some peach fruitiness, and tartness. The 2012 was a bit more lively and flavorful though. This is one to drink fresh. Nice. Rating for 2012.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
2013 vintage. 750ml white waxed bottle into a HF over sized wine glass.

A - Pours a hazy...well its a peach colored body. An initial fingers worth of soapy foam with large bubbles forms but settles into some edging pretty quickly. Decent lacing with minimal retention. The peach color though, man does it look good. 

S - Super funky brettanomyces and lactic acid followed by over ripe peach juice. There is a subtle, almost spicy vanilla thing that I get on the very end that I would imagine is coming from the barrels.

T - That distinct brett funk followed by a wave of lactic acid twang. This goes head to head with sweet peach juice and a touch of oak. Lightly sour with a long lasting juiciness. This is a very drinkable beer and something that is perfect for the warmer months. Mouth feel is crisp and lively while maintaining a medium body.

O - This beer is excellent. Truly one of the best American Wilds I have had the privilege of trying. I wish I had it a bit fresher as the peaches are sort of playing second fiddle to the critters, but god damn is this a tasty beer!

Thanks to Y, who shared a bottle at Brians  birthday gathering.  or, mediocre aroma.  A very peachy brew from Oregon, with dashes of coconut, brett sourness, and honeysuckle.  A unique brew for sure - I would like to see some more things from this bewery.
Bottle @ ZeeBra Extreme Beer Festival 2013. Hazy yellow pour. Aroma of citrus, brett, fruity, spicy, peachy. Flavor is slightly sour, sweet fruity, spicy and with a nice balance.

Bottle @ ZeeBra. Aroma is big fruity hops, almost watermelon candy like in combination with the fruity funky sour notes. Flavour has a big array of fruity flavours, al covered in a subtle refreshing sour note. Awesome.

ZEBF13
smells funky, like cantillon a bit. so comparing to fou foune, becomes logic. 
pours blonde, white fopam. taste is much more peachy than the foune. very nice! but would like more sour/funk....
Yellow hazy body, white head. Wheat, orange, little funk. Rustic, wheat, rough malt. Really tastes artisanal. Really nice rich taste. (ZeeBra)
bottle. pours yellow/orange with crisp white head. aroma is funky fruit. taste is tart and sour aplle and peach.

Pours a very low head straw golden color.  Aroma is perfumey peaches and lemon zing.  Taste is nice apricot/peach flavor with a finish of vinegar.  Quite tart and acetic but the fruityness does a great job of balancing that.  Could use some more funk or complexity but still quite good.
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2013 Fantasic stuff, great fruit flavors and very tart. I really enjoy this, great murky flavor.

750ml bottle split at Madison tasting.  Cloudy golden-tan.  Delicate soft, cloudy peach tones.  This is pretty nice.  Peach juice and creamy edged sour tones combine.  Quite excellent and unique.  Exceptionally fresh, quality feel.  Delicate, peaches and cream dream.

Bouteille de 750 ml, batch 1. Arômes lactiques (yogourt) et de pêches. Légère présence vineuse et boisée. Robe orangée et trouble, peu de mousse et effervescence relativement faible. En bouche, une belle acidité lactique domine et le caractère des lactobacillus est bien présent (yogourt). Les fruits demeurent frais et se marient bien au caractère de la levure. Le passage en fût de chêne contribue des notes vineuses et boisées, mais lintégration nest pas aussi bien réussie que dans les meilleurs exemples du style. Longue finale passablement lactique. Une très belle bière sûre, mais tout de même pas du niveau des meilleurs lambics aux fruits.

shared dont know what batch at CFH thanks chris  poured a cloudy orange yellow small white head, nose was peaches and a little zesty orange also maybe a hint of pepper great tart taste no sting just sour really well put together beer

750, capped and waxed. Thanks j! What a hell of an awesome treat. Pours a cloudy bright pale orange with a loose fizzy off-tan head. Gorgeous big tangy sweet nose, not piercing, but quite powerful. Shows lots of peaches and some pleasant estery tang, a little lemon and subtle white vinegar dialed way back. Creamy medium body--not quite the coating velvety pulp it might be, but really nice. Pleasant peaches, a bit of lemony tang, and minerals on the mid palate. Long tangy fruity finish. Awesome.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2013 Batch 1 again. Cloudy, orange pour and white head. Funky cheese, peaches galore, pears. Tart, funky, intensely fruity. Fantastic. Miles ahead of b2.

Batch 2 review (=3.3). Yeasty, effervescent aroma. Tastes yeasty too, not nearly as much peach as the previous batch. A touch watery; needs more depth of flavor. Batch 1 is way better in all regards.

750ml bottle from cavemanlawyer, thanks James! Pours a cloudy, yellow-orange colored body with a finger-width, fizzy and frothy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is pretty awesome. Sour peaches and apricots with just a touch of sweetness, lots of funk, some florals, a bit of a lemon acidity, wood, hints of vanilla, and a light bready malt backing. Flavor is similar with a bit more wood showing up. Funky and sour up front with a bunch of peaches and apricots. A bit of an acidic lemon, a light bready malt, and some florals come in during the middle before a nice woody note comes in and a bunch of vanilla leads this into the finish where it ends very dry and clean, funky, and sour with a bit of pucker and a woody bitterness. Lengthy aftertaste following a light body and a somewhat lively, moderate carbonation. Overall, a really well done beer. Fruity, funky, and sour with a nice woody and vanilla element. Dry, clean, and refreshing. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2013 Bottle @ Stephens house courtesy of Steve_0. Huge thanks! Pours a milky yellow orange appearance with a white head. Big peachy, juicy apricot fruity, tart aroma. Fucking awesome fruity peach, vanilla, lightly oaky, juicy flavor. Kick ass beer folks!

Bottle at home with friends. Pour is hazy orange with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Ripe peaches, brett, pineapple, pears, green apples, light urine, lactic acid, and lemon peel in the aroma. Taste is highy acetic, light spice, vanilla, peach skin, white wine, grapes, and pears with a medium sour finish. Medium body with high carbonation. The smell blows me away, and the tastes is awesome, but falls a bit short when compared to the aroma. Still a wonderful sour.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thanks to Stephen! Hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of huge fresh peach, hints of vanilla, brett, nice toffee, biscuit, bread, slight earth, nice tart lemon notes as well, wow.  Taste is a mix of nice sweet biscuit, bread, nice peach and vanilla notes, hints of funk, slight bread, brett, hints of earth, spice, finishing fairly peachy, slight white fruit.  Delicious.

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium yellow orange colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity, wheat, citrus, horse blanket, barnyard, apricot, sweet vinegar, earthy notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light moderate acidic with a long duration, tart, dry, acidic, apricot - peach. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121109]
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head.  Aroma is yeast, malt, brett, peaches, vanilla, oak. Flavour is yeast, malt, brett, peaches, vanilla, oak. Nice beer.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours kinda blond with no head. Aroma is of sligthly rotten peaches. Taste is of peaches, sourness, fruits. Palate: Low carbonation, ligth body. Overall: Very good.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by Julien, Pier-Luc and Benoît, huge thanks! Yellow/golden with a medium quickly disappearing white head. No lacing. Aroma is of peaches and tropical fruits with a slight acetic presence. Taste is moderately sweet and sour with a lot of peaches and some tropical fruits. Mouthfeel is moderately dry. Light to medium body. Its a good Sour, but maybe a tad too much on the "fruit juice" side.

Bottle. Clear gold pour, white head that fades quickly. Aroma of peaches, light acetic aroma, quite subtle, slightly cheesy/lactic. Taste is actually really fruity and sweet, peach juice, very light sourness, a bit berliner weiss like. Palate is medium bodied with light-med carbonation. Good.

Bottle. Hazy orange liquid with small white head. Aroma of mineraly fruit, lemon, light barnyard, peaches and red berries. Taste is dry and light to medium sour with notes of peaches and lemons. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice, very fruity.

Several bottles over the last 9 months. Pours with a hazed golden hued body and a small white head. Aromas are of peaches, apricots, funk, mineral, estery, clean. Good floral notes and juicy stone fruit. Flavors are very tasty, medium and mostly clean lactic acid with a touch of acetic. Bone dry, lots of stone fruit, nice peach with medium to low funk. Lively bubbles, dry and puckering. Tasty.

Bottle shared by starrdogg. Thanks Matt.

The beer appears hazy and yellow hued with a small white head. Loving the aroma - peaches, stone fruit, musty, yeast, funk. Teeming with delicious flavor. Light bodied and effortless to drink. A mild tartness in the finish. Superb. I definitely recommend this one.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-18-2012

full kilt ahead!! .. . pours a deep amber .. great head, lacing .. . wow, refreshing and a touch tart .. . peach and peach skin .. . killer stuff, i enjoyed this

 . .. . i could eat a peach for days..

750mL bottle, pours an opaque orange with a small white head. Aroma of peaches, lots of acidity and very sour fruits. Flavour brings out loads of tart peaches, a little vanilla and oak, and medium acidity. Full-bodied and complex. Very enjoyable.

Bottle, 75cl. Its a clear one, well theres a light haze, golden in color and with a small, white head. Peaches, barnyard, some maltyness, vinegar hints and a leathery note in the aroma. Very tart on the palate, teeth-cleansing, medium bodied and quite flat. Lots of peaches in the flavor, quite funky and lemony. Lasting finish with mostly peaches. Well, its nice indeed, but its actually too dry to be pleasant too drink. Wouldnt mind having it again though. 121109

Bottle 750ml @ fonefan
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, vinegar, tart and acetone. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a very dry and sour finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft to fizzy.
Bottle, 5.75% @ FOneFan. Slightly hazy deep golden with no head. Aroma is malt, wheat, barnyard and little tart. Flavour is malt, tart, barnyard, very dry, citric and light acetone.
Botte @ fonefan tasting. Hazy golden with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, medicine and barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 091112
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, malt, fruits, leather, barnyard and hops. Nice and acidic.

Pours a hazy deep gold, no head at all. Aroma of peach, Brett and lacto.  Really complex, a lot going on here. Really nice sour. One of the best, really tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Khumbard for the share. 750 ml waxed bottle served in a Deschutes snifter.

A: Pours a clear amber color with a frothy white head forming on the pour. It recedes to an airy ring that leaves some splotches of lace.

S: Sweet fruit with peach flesh coming through and then some soft pear. Mild red berry with some tartness and light pale malt. Not much in the form of sourness going on in the nose.

T: The taste wasnt as substantial as the nose for me. Some light peach flesh and red apple skins, a mild tartness and the slightest hint of lacto sourness. Definitely some sweet malts in the finish, but there really wasnt anything for it to cut through.

M: Light bodied with a clean and sweet finish. Nice prickly carbonation as well.

O: Definitely missed a lot of the lacto qualities in this one. It lost a lot of points as it didnt quite fit the bill I was hoping for. The nose gave it promise, but the taste fell a little flat. It was still an easy drinking beer that tastes good, though. Recommend.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-08-2012

750mL bottle from brewery last year.

A: Cloudy dark yellow. No head. No legs.

N: Peach, acetone, and a little wood. A fair amount of vinegar. Lemon sourness.

T: Fading peach, lemon, and a touch of vinegar. Fairly tart. This is about average. Might be on the downslope, too.

M: Light and well carbonated.

O: Pretty good, but its not nearly as good as something like Peche N Brett. Never tasted a lot of peach in this, though its less sour than I remember.
Bottle shared by thomas thanks man.  Poured a hazy orange, nice tart citrus smell, didnt get much scent of peach.  Flavor reminded me of fou foune with peach skin.  Really amazing sour

(750ml bottle)  Pours a hazy golden orange body with a medium white head.  Aroma of florals, citrus, peach, barnyard, and melon.  Flavor of citrus, florals, and peach with a moderately dry oak finish.

Bottle.   Aroma of clean bright lactic acid with some dusty peaches.   Not terribly complex, but pretty tasty.   Moderate to heavy yogurt and lemon sourness.   Juicy peach and apricot is nice, but could use more fruit presence. Pretty good.   Liked.

750ml bottle. Courtesy of the Lu.  Our swansong beer that Shawn has been saving for me... Pours a somewhat hazy golden apricot hue topped with a minimal soapy white film that reduces down to a ring around the collar... Semi-sharp acidity with lemon and lighter peachy accents. Slightly lactic it seems. Quality and not too abrasive in any direction... Flavors follow suit closely to the aroma with semi-sharp acidic touches but not overbearing to the point of being abrasive. Body teeters just shy of medium with semi-lively carbonation.  Wish the peaches were a bit more expressive but generally enjoyable.

750 ml. bottle. It pours a very clear golden orange with a disappearing white head. The aroma has some sour peaches, white grape, straw and hints of  vinegar. The flavor is pretty much the same. Big sour peaches up front that fills the mouth then some oak, straw and light funk before some faint notes of vinegar. Very full bodied for a medium gravity sour with good peach flavor. Not as much funk as I would like. A very nice sour, but not exactly worthy of whale status.

Cloudy straw color with fizzy white head.  Smell is slightly tart, bit of peach.  Taste is peach and sour, not overly sour. This beer is a hell of a drinker, great flavor, right amount of sour, right amount of fruit.

(750ml bottle)  clouy light yellow, wispy white bubbles. Nose of bright cherry, tart, rich caramel, cranberry and some herbal agave that mixes really well. Taste is quite tart, stone fruit, peaches, subtle herbs, complex and absolutely delicious.

750 ml bottle shared by bsuedekum- thanks a ton, Blake! I know this one took a big trade to get. Sexy label. Hello there. Pours a hazy peach-gold color with no head. Aroma of sweet, fresh peaches and tart lemons, vanilla, funk, oak, and yogurt. The flavor is mostly the same, with peaches, lemon, yogurt, oak, funk, and very faint acidity. Light-medium bodied, with low carbonation and a sour, juicy mouthfeel. Dry finish. Excellent sour. Really nice.

75cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2012, with peaches, thx to Secret Santa!, complex sour fruit brew, sour/fruity and slightly woody, very balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, very good brew, yet very expensive!

750ml bottle shared by JoeTheYounger, thanks man. Rating #48. Nice beer, clearish orange/yellow pour. Nice light peach aroma, very light. Slightly dry and tart eith a little fruity sweetness with a nice tart finish. (2455)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small whit ehead. Has a fruity sour tart barnyard aroma. Fruity sour tart citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart finish.
August 5, 2012 bottle shared by Brett at his tasting event.  Semi-opaque yellowish orange pour with no head.  Citrus / fruity sour funk in the aroma and taste.  Thin body and easy to drink.

Bottle... This beer rocks!... Cloudy peach-colored ale with a brief, miniscule white head. The bouquet offers big notes of fruity peach, bready malt and toasted oak with a trace of vanilla. More simply-put, it smells like peach cobbler. Medium to full-bodied with gentle carbonation. The flavor is an interplay of tart, mildly sweet, peachy, lemony goodness and modest, tannic, woody bitterness.  Tart, fruity, tangy finish. World class beer shared by landhoney!
75 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, barnyard and citric. Smooth fruity and lingering slight acidic. Smooth fruity finish.
Bottle shared at RBSG Grand Tasting, 2012. Orangish-gold with lace. Sour, lemon nose. Clean lemon. Semi-sour flavor. Lemon and other citrus, a little bit of funk and lactic flavors. Very nice.

Huge thanks to sideshowe for sharing. 

Pours a bright golden orange color with visible carbonation and a half finger white head that slowly fades into a lasting ring.  Spotty lacing left behind.

Earthy, funky aroma with lots of barnyard bug character balanced by strong tropical and light fruit notes.  Some toasted oak and a very prominent peach skin character.  Im even picking up the pit of the fruit.  

Medium bodied with a nice tart funkiness that isnt harsh or acetic. Lots of oak and funky bugs along with a strong peach presence.  Nicely balanced and easy to drink with the juicy peach flavor countering the barrel and funk.  Again, the skin of the fruit, and even the pit, are noticeable to the palate.  Very refreshing and easy to drink.

Bottle sampled at Muckfest III. Clear gold pour with a thin white head. Peppery and sour aroma with some stone fruit notes. Malty and hugely peachy flavor with a citrusy sour finish. Pretty delicious.

750mL white wax pouring at RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours a full haze tangerine. Nose is peach pie, vanilla, pie crust, butter, coconut. Wow. Taste is sweet peach, coconut, vanilla, buttery pie crust. Orange citric acid blends with lactic and small acetic. Very enjoyable. Better than Veritas 010, which we had back to back.

750ml waxed bottle.  Rich honey golden with little bit of tight white head.  Creamy lacto, turbando sugar, peach, plum, pits, musty peach skin, vanilla, slight acetone on the end.  Mellow carbonation and slightly chewy feel.  Meaty musty peach, slightly musty/dank, white wine grapes tannins, white wine oak.  Little bit of acetone really keeps this from being top tier, but still really glad to have had one.

White wine funky notes here and there fresh peach creamy notes. Nice and peachy. Golden orange pour no head. Some what still looking. Fuzzy fresh peach light creamy sweetness white wine barrel notes. Lightly tart nice and fruity. Really easy to drink. Light thirst quenching and nice.

Bottle shared at MuckFest 3 - Saturday Edition. Pours a richly glowing golden hue, with richer haze. Sunlight glow with a touch of darkness in the middle. Frothy offwhite head sits atop, dies to a ring and laces small. Aromas are sour apricots and lactic acid. Firm sourness and funk, dry yeasty elements, crisp bready malts, touches of lactic yogurt, touches of bretty funk. Richer sour sweet apricot nose. Initial is lighter bodied, a rich spritzy sour funk, lactic lemons, apricots are fairly rich and refreshing. Fresh and vibrant, good flavors of yogurt, apricots. Really nice and refreshing, touches of brett, funk but mainly about the sour liveliness. Really good fresh fruit sour.

Bottle shared by my man Seth.  Clear pale yellow pour with a fleeting white head.  Peach and light funk aromas.  Smooth and refreshing with good carbonation and mouthfeel.  Peach and light sourness.  Taste like the same base beer as Four Play??
Sweet, peachy pale malt. Slight sour, white wine. Probably the best of the night, very balanced between bitter and sweet.

Rate based on second bottle I had (first wasnt as fruit forward or creamy). Slow gush on opening. Pours a yellowish, light orange with a thin frothed head. Nose is sticky, prickly fruit full of apricot and peach notes and a tiny bit of yogurt. Creamy mouth feel. Beer drinks softly with no real alcohol presence to speak of and finishes with some bitter fruit skin. Creepy girl on the label gets a bit cuter when you get to the end of the bottle.

Bottle shared with Bill along with my Southampton Black Raspberry Lambic.for contrast. Poured a hazy golden color and had a small fluffy head. Nose is like peach yogurt with a slight amount of funk. Taste is sweeter than expected, with loads of peaches, vanilla and some woodiness, This is a nice brew with a medium finish and good carbonation. Great tart flavors...try some.
Bottle shared with marcus. Beer is amazing.  Nice sour. Not to sour with a nice peach flavor. Aroma is funky an sour. Has a nice balance of sour an fruit.

Capped 750 shared by Marcus. Pours hazy peach with a transient white head. Aroma is lactic sour peach - earthy barnyard. Med minus body. Flavor is barnyard sour peach. Finishes dry and sour and peachy. Delicious.

Pours murky golden with a delightful peach aroma that filled the room upon opening the bottle. There is a delicate peach flavor with a sour finish. A very well-constructed brew that isboth tasty and easy to drnk.

Pour from a bottle into the glass gave a golden orange color with a medium sized white head. Aromas are of primarily earthy natural peach with an undertone of earthy funk and brett. Medium body with flavors initially sweet fruit and moderate lactic sour qualities kicking in. Very rich flavor profile and long tasty finish. Finishes balanced and dry and certainly not too sweet. Really great sour .

Tweet
A: Poured like liquid grapefruit with a small fiizy white head. 

S: Tangy and tart fruits with peach, a light lemon zest, some funk and oak spirals

T: The peach is very nice upfront with some tartness, sugar, funky and oak spirals, old wood w/ a light Earthiness in the background. A tad acidic and stinging

M: Medium bodied, well carbonated with great taste, some funk remaining on the palate with a crisp finish

O: Very good beer and the peach twist was new and amazing. Well played.

Bottle. Pours a hazy (and more murky with the sediment towards the end) golden orange with minimal head.  Smell is certainly peaches and an acetone like tartness.  Taste is tart with obvious peaches but well integrated peaches, crisp, clean, long lasting tart peachy finish, musky, but very soft.  NOTE:  I had this on tap at the release and while the peach has faded just ever so slightly over the past several months from memory, the tartness is a bit more crisp.  Just a damn good beer all around.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2012 Bottle with and compliments of James. Pours a murky golden orange color, thin ring of head on the outer layer of the glass, small to med lace. Aromas of barn, gueuze, tangerine, vanilla powder, and oak. Taste is very lactic, with ultra fresh lemon peels abound. As it warmed it became less sour and more vanilla and complex...some notes of swiss cheese in the aroma. I still think this is closer to a sour but all around an excellent beer that caught me by surprise.

Bottle split with vin and Linh. Pours a bright orange with thin white lacing brimming my glass. Aroma is funky Brett, chlorine and fresh peaches.  Incredible. Mouthfeel is slightly puckering with notes of sour, funky peaches, tart fruit, and a dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Hazy, golden-orange body, medium sized white head. Faint skim left behind.  Dry peach notes dominate the nose while a light oak and brett character rounds things out.  The flavor surprised me with a bold, juicy peach character.  Moderate lactic acidity makes itself known.  The assertive sourness makes up for a bit of undercarbonation and keeps wave after wave of flavor coming across the tongue.  Nice lighter body and the peach flavor is tremendously refreshing.

pour is bright golden orange with a thin white ring. The nose is excellent, dry oak combines with a light dusty Brett and well integrated peach. Taste is much of the same with a light lactic cream note and hints of vanilla mid to back palate. The peach is bright and strong, the body is light with a pleasant soft carbonation. There is a light sourness to accompany a fairly dry finish. Very good stuff.

hazy gold amber, large bubbled white gravity head reduces to ring. Nose is heavy peach skin and pulp, bit of lotion, super rich fruit with appropriate sourness, the best young foufounes on fruit crack without quite the interplay. Flavor is sweet peach pulp up front, smarties and egg across mid, heavy peach with lactic sourness through finish. Lower carbonation but small bubbled and fizzy. Very heavy rind, bitter with more fruit pulp in end. Delicious, balanced, reminiscent of festina lente in fruit strength but higher carbonation and lower acetic qualities.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2012 Pours honey golden with a light orange hue and small white head. The aroma of fresh peaches come through with a nice crispness, a little soft and velvety sweet on the second time around. The flavor is juicy and delicious, juicier than any peach sour beer I have had. The light tart flavor is tame but there with beautiful sweet peach flavors and some zing/zest that settles so well on the palate.

Huge, huge thanks to boralyl for getting this bottle out my way. Served in a SAVOR wine glass.

Pours a nice peachy color with a foamy white head with good retention and a ring or two of lacing on the way down. The nose carries a tremendous peach presence that is just absolutely killer. Behind that is a light bit of pilsner malt along with a fairly-strong lactic presence.

The flavor hits the peach and lactic combination quite well, but lacks enough earthy and wild depth to really take it over the top. With that said, Im still quite impressed, especially flowing into the feel, which has a nice level of acidity to make the peach flavor.

Overall, a very impressive offering from Upright. With this, Im very excited to try some future offerings coming out of this place.
Bottle shared at my house. Pours cloudy apricot. Nose/taste of sour peach, funk, lemon, old cheese, wood and sour peach skins. Light. Low acidity. Well balanced. Medium body.

25.4 oz bottle.  Clear gold with white froth.  Nose is light peach, wet meadow and toffee.  Juicy, mouth watering, a bit sticky with a buzz.  Taste is intense sour peach puree, leather, vanilla and citrus pith.  Wonderfully drinkable.

Bottle shared by deyholla at local tasting, thanks Derek!  Pours a hazy light golden with a small white head, the aroma punches you in the face with peaches right away with a slight amount of funk, the flavor really hammers home the funk with an acidict finish, some fruit notes as well.  Man this stuff was amazing.

Bottle at a tasting at James place, courtesy of James.  Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head.  Nice and funky, soft musk.  Saison notes like crazy.  Medium bodied, super delicate, the carbonation here is wonderful.  Musky, light acid, very gentle.  So nice.  Funky, bits of lemony acid.  Lingering funk.  Beautiful.

Appearance:  Pours a an amber gold with no head.

Aroma:  A little chlorine/clorox, peach and funk.

Taste:  Peach pit, tannins, tart peach, earthy yeast, finishes sour and peachy.

Mouthfeel:  Lively sparling wine like.

Overall: Now I know why those Pacific Northwesters wont part with this beer for trade. A real work of art.

From notes.

The beer itself is a hazy tangerine color.  Very hazy with golden edges and a fair amount of sediment rests on the bottom of the glass.

The aroma is lactic and peach, with a strong and pleasant flavor.  There is a bit of acetic or vinegar tartness in the nose as well.  A bit of vanilla yogurt and oak round out the aroma.  A little bit of barnyard in the back.

The flavor starts a little bit sweet.  There is a touch of sweet honey of pale malt before sweet peach and vanilla slowly turns tart and lactic.  There is a little bit of a growing lemon zest as the sip goes on.  

The body is on the fuller side of medium for an American Wild.  The carbonation is medium and smooth, with a slightly grainy tone.  It is sour, with both lactic and some acetic notes.

This is a great young peach sour.

Opened this bottle for Barons bday. Poured into a Jackie Os glass. The beer is a hazy peach color and had a small amount of soapy head. Nose is underwhelming, there is a little peach yogurt character to the nose, not much acidity though. Interesting peach character in the flavor profile, there is peach yogurt, cinnamon, and vanilla. More carbonated than the first bottle we cracked, but still gentle carbonation. Some light acidity, and a medium to long finish. Second bottle was a pleasant surprise, a lot better than the first we opened. Fresh peach punches you in the face and never lets up. Nice, tart flavor.
Pours out a murky golden brown with limited carb.  Tastes like fresh yogurt and peaches.  Its tart, but not overly sour.  Impressive beer.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2012 Slightly hazy, yellow/gold pour with a minimal head.  Gorgeous peaches in the nose ... slight wood/vanilla as it warms, along with a restrained touch of cheesy funk.  I could smell this all night.  Flavor shines with peaches and stone fruit skins that are carried by a nice lemony tartness.  Body is light to medium, carb is lively, and the finish is where I am torn.  The tartness is great, but there is also a vinegar-like acidity that is just a bit too sharp.  Still very enjoyable (love the freshness of the fruit and the light, cheesy funk), but that overt sharpness really hinders the drinkability for me.

Thanks to Wally for this treat!  Poured into a tulip glass.  Cloudy orange body without much of any head.  Aroma is filled with soured peaches, light acetone and some grassy notes.  Flavor is much the same but adds some creamy vanilla components.  Nice level of sourness throughout.  Brings Fou Foune to mind, but isnt any easier for me to get, haha.  Definitely worth trying if you can find it.

Wow. Only 8 ratings. A friend brought this over following a trade with a west coast partner. Poured at room temp into a tulip

A - 1/4 finger on a vigorous pour. This is a deep orange beer with plenty of clouds and some yellow in here.

S - Orange Peels are very pleasant. Lots of peach juice, sour and tart scents with lavender and honey. VERY enjoyable.

T - Sour is right out of the gate BOOM. Peaches are next and add a tart and pucker thats just like eating a peach with the fuzzy left on. Lemons, floral and some oak comes through at the end.

M - 50/50 bubbles on a mouth swish. Its a very dry beer with great floral lingering.

O - UTTERLY DELICIOUS. I need many more of these NOW.

Pours a hazed golden orange color with a white head.  An amazing fruit aroma.  Tons of peaches on the nose which give a nice sweetness along with the tartness of the beer.  Oak, grass, and lemon provide a nice funk and sourness.  The peaches are just as vibrant on the palate.  Intense fruit flavor with background notes of oak, lemon, lemon peel, and grass.  A hint of vanilla from the oak as the beer warms.  Really outstanding stuff.

Bottle courtesy of deyholla. Pours hazy orange, bordering on garnet. Very little head, especially by a couple of minutes in. Good carbonation, but soft. Nose: wow. Just barrels and barrels of ripe peach, sweetened vinegar, candied citrus. More peach in a big way on the tongue, massive tartness and barnyard-ish funk. This was right in the middle of an epic tasting, and it still stands out as the highlight. Exceptional.
Bottle shared by deyholla thanks Derick .  So far this is the star of the night.  I am all stuffed up and it still smells fantastic.   Peach and tartness just fantastic.

Bottle shared by deyholla...thanks Derek! - Hazy light amber with a thin foamy white head. Wow...the nose is great. Fresh peaches with a nice acidic note--ridiculously fresh. Not a ton of funk on the nose, but just a touch of sharpness. The taste is much more funky. Lots of acidic, vinegary notes, lemon and a bit cheesy. Feathery, fluffy carbonation. Beautiful beer.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 Bottle thanks to westmeister! Pours a cloudy peach gold with a white head that starts at the edges and dissipates completely. Aroma is full of peach with a light tartness and a nice earthy funk note. Flavor starts a really nice juicy peach note with a growing tartness and a hint of funk.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2012 Bottle. Pours a deep color amber orange color with a slight collared white head. Slightly cloudy. Nice aroma, a little on the sweet side but a nice peach note along with some funkiness. More on the acidic side than true european funk. Light/medium mouthfeel. Nice sweet peach notes with a nice mild sourness. A slight bitterness in the end but very mild. I could see this getting more sour with some age.  This is a very solid beer but for sure not as deep and extreme as the belgian styles but for a US version it is really good. Glad I grabbed a few bottles to let this develop more. Thought this beer was extremely well done.
Yellow/orangish pour. Peaches, acedic acid, yeasty aroma. Lots of peaches, sourness, vinegar, light woody notes. Nice!

Bottle shared at recent BA/RB tasting...  Poured a hazy, pale orange with a white head.  Good peach flavors with some acidic sourness.  A little bit of funk and earthiness.  Not too much carbonation, and nice soft mouthfeel.  Good tasting, quenching.  Not overly complex for the high price tag.
